current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Designating the week beginning October 20, 2013, as

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

text.#text: That the

designates the week beginning October 20,
			 2013, as

calls upon the people of the United States
			 and interested groups—

to embrace the elements of character
			 identified by local schools and communities, such as trustworthiness, respect,
			 responsibility, fairness, caring, and citizenship; and

to observe the week with appropriate
			 ceremonies, programs, and activities.

Whereas
			 the character education of children has become more urgent, as violence by and
			 against youth increasingly threatens the physical and psychological well-being
			 of the people of the United States;

Whereas, more than ever, children need
			 strong and constructive guidance from their families and their communities,
			 including schools, youth organizations, religious institutions, and civic
			 groups;

Whereas
			 the public good is advanced when young people are taught the importance of good
			 character and the positive effects that good character can have in personal
			 relationships, in school, and in the workplace;

Whereas
			 scholars and educators agree that people do not automatically develop good
			 character and that, therefore, conscientious efforts must be made by
			 institutions and individuals that influence youth to help young people develop
			 the essential traits and characteristics that comprise good character;

Whereas, although character development is,
			 first and foremost, an obligation of families, the efforts of faith
			 communities, schools, and youth, civic, and human service organizations also
			 play an important role in fostering and promoting good character;
Whereas

Whereas
			 the character and conduct of our youth reflect the character and conduct of
			 society, and, therefore, every adult has the responsibility to teach and model
			 ethical values and every social institution has the responsibility to promote
			 the development of good character;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
encourages individuals and organizations, especially those that have
			 an interest in the education and training of the young people of the United
			 States, to adopt the elements of character as intrinsic to the well-being of
			 individuals, communities, and society;

text.#text: Whereas

Whereas
			 many schools in the United States recognize the need, and have taken steps, to
			 integrate the values of their communities into their teaching activities;
			 and

term.#tail:
, during
			 which individuals, families, schools, youth organizations, religious
			 institutions, civic groups, and other organizations focus on character
			 education, is of great benefit to the United States: Now, therefore, be
			 it

text.#text:
Whereas
			 the establishment of

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 272 ATS: Designating the week beginning October 20, 2013, as National Character Counts Week.
